_comment: These are the default properties for Traffic Portal. Customize these values to fit your needs.

api._comment: This should have the same value found in /etc/traffic_portal/conf/config.js

dashboard._comments: These are configurable properties for the dashboard

snapshot._comments: These are configurable properties for a cdn snapshot

diff._comments: The number of lines of context provided before and after a addition or removal

dsRequests._comments: Should all delivery service changes go through the delivery service review process?

cacheChecks._comments: These are configurable properties for the cache checks view. The data for the cache checks view is derived from TO extensions. The extensions array should include an entry for each of your extensions or you can check GET api/1.3/servers/checks to see which checks you have configured.

updatePending.desc: Configuration file updates have been applied or are pending for the EDGE or MID

revalPending.desc: Content invalidation request(s) are pending for the EDGE or MID

extensions.desc: Ping the iLO interface for EDGE or MID servers
Ping the IPv4 address of the EDGE or MID servers
DNS check that matches what the DNS servers responds with compared to what Traffic Ops has
Checks the DSCP value of packets from the edge server to the Traffic Ops server
Ping the IPv6 address of the EDGE or MID servers
Ping the EDGE or MID using the configured MTU from Traffic Ops
Number of configuration differences as determined by ORT found between Traffic Ops and the cache

charts._comment: Do you want to show a charts button for each ds? If so, where can the charts be found? xml id will be appended to the provided url.
Do you want to show a charts button for each server? If so, where can the charts be found? xml id will be appended to the provided url.

defaults._comments: These are default values used when creating resources

descriptions._comments: This is the text used to configure delivery service field titles/descriptions

active.title: Active
active.desc: When this is set to false Traffic Router will not serve DNS or HTTP responses for this delivery service.

cacheurl.title: Cache URL expression
cacheurl.desc:
Cache URL rule to apply to this delivery service.

See ATS documentation on cacheurl...

ccrDnsTtl.title: Delivery Service DNS TTL
ccrDnsTtl.desc: The Time To Live on the DNS record for the Traffic Router A and AAAA records.

cdnId.title: CDN
cdnId.desc: The CDN in which the delivery service belongs to.

checkPath.title: Check Path
checkPath.desc: A path (ex: /crossdomain.xml) to verify the connection to the origin server with. This can be used by Check Extension scripts to do periodic health checks against the delivery service.

deepCachingType.title: Deep Caching
deepCachingType.desc:
When to do deep caching for this delivery service.

See Deep Caching for more details...

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.desc: A human-readable name for the delivery service.

dnsBypassIp.title: DNS Bypass IP
dnsBypassIp.desc: This is the address to respond to A requests with when the max Bps or Max Tps for this delivery service are exceeded.

dnsBypassIp6.title: DNS Bypass IPv6
dnsBypassIp6.desc: This is the address to respond to AAAA requests with when the max Bps or Max Tps for this delivery service are exceeded.

dscp.title: DSCP
dscp.desc: The DSCP value to mark IP packets to the client with.

edgeHeaderRewrite.title: Edge Header Rewrite Rules
edgeHeaderRewrite.desc:
Header Rewrite rules to apply for this delivery service at the EDGE tier.

See Header Rewrite Options and DSCP...

geoLimitRedirectURL.title: Geo Limit Redirect URL
geoLimitRedirectURL.desc:
This is the URL Traffic Router will redirect to when Geo Limit Failure.

See GeoLimit Failure Redirect feature...

geoLimit.title: Geo Limit
geoLimit.desc:
Some services are intended to be limited by geography.

See more...

globalMaxMbps.title: Global Max Mbps
globalMaxMbps.desc: The maximum bits per second this delivery service can serve across all EDGE caches before traffic will be diverted to the bypass destination. For a DNS delivery service, the Bypass Ipv4 or Ipv6 will be used (depending on whether this was a A or AAAA request), and for HTTP delivery services the Bypass FQDN will be used.

globalMaxTps.title: Global Max TPS
globalMaxTps.desc: The maximum transactions this delivery service can serve across all EDGE caches before traffic will be diverted to the bypass destination. For a DNS delivery service, the Bypass Ipv4 or Ipv6 will be used (depending on whether this was a A or AAAA request), and for HTTP delivery services the Bypass FQDN will be used.

fqPacingRate.title: Fair Queuing Pacing Rate Bps
fqPacingRate.desc: The maximum bytes per second a cache will delivery on any single TCP connection. This uses the Linux kernel's Fair Queuing setsockopt(SO_MAX_PACING_RATE) to limit the rate of delivery.

httpBypassFqdn.title: HTTP Bypass FQDN
httpBypassFqdn.desc: This is the FQDN Traffic Router will redirect to (with the same path) when the max Bps or Max Tps for this delivery service are exceeded.

infoUrl.title: Info URL
infoUrl.desc: Info URL for this delivery service.

ipv6RoutingEnabled.title: IPv6 Routing Enabled
ipv6RoutingEnabled.desc: When set to true, the Traffic Router will respond to AAAA DNS requests for the routed name of this delivery service. Otherwise, only A records will be served.

longDesc.title: Long Description
longDesc.desc: Long description for this delivery service.

longDesc1.title: Long Description 2
longDesc1.desc: Long description 2 for this delivery service.

longDesc2.title: Long Description 3
longDesc2.desc: Long description 3 for this delivery service.

midHeaderRewrite.title: Mid Header Rewrite Rules
midHeaderRewrite.desc:
Header Rewrite rules to apply for this delivery service at the EDGE tier.

See Header Rewrite Options and DSCP...

missLat.title: Geo Miss Default Latitude
missLat.desc: Default Latitude for this delivery service. When client localization fails for both Coverage Zone and Geo Lookup, the client will be routed as if it was at this lat.

missLong.title: Geo Miss Default Longitude
missLong.desc: Default Longitude for this delivery service. When client localization fails for both Coverage Zone and Geo Lookup, the client will be routed as if it was at this long.

multiSiteOrigin.title: Use Multi Site Origin Feature
multiSiteOrigin.desc:
Enable the Multi Site Origin feature for this delivery service.

See Multi Site Origin...

orgServerFqdn.title: Origin Server Base URL
orgServerFqdn.desc: The Origin Serverâ€™s base URL. This includes the protocol (http or https). Example: http://movies.origin.com

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.desc:
The protocol to serve this delivery service to the clients with.

See more...

qstringIgnore.title: Query String Handling
qstringIgnore.desc:
How to treat query strings.

See more...

rangeRequestHandling.title: Range Request Handling
rangeRequestHandling.desc:
How to treat range requests.

See more...

regexRemap.title: Regex remap expression
regexRemap.desc:
Regex Remap rule to apply to this delivery service at the Edge tier.

See more...

remapText.title: Raw remap text
remapText.desc: For HTTP and DNS delivery services, this will get added to the end of the remap line on the cache verbatim. For ANY_MAP delivery services this is the remap line.

routingName.title: Routing Name
routingName.desc: The routing name to use for the delivery FQDN, i.e. routing-name.deliveryservice.cdn-domain. It must be a valid hostname without periods.

tenantId.title: Tenant
tenantId.desc: By selecting a tenant for the delivery service, you restrict access of that delivery service to only those users that belong to the same tenant or a parent tenant.

typeId.title: Content Routing Type
typeId.desc:
The type of content routing this delivery service will use.

See Delivery Service Types....

xmlId.title: Key (XML ID)
xmlId.desc: A unique string that identifies this delivery service.

customMenu._comments: These are custom items you want to add to the menu. 'items' is an array of hashes where each hash has 'name' (the menu item name), 'embed' (true|false to determine if content is embedded in TP or not), and 'url' (the url of the content)
customMenu.name: Other
